'''Earl Davis''' is a man with dementia who was dropped off at the fire station.

==History==
Earl came into the fire station looking for the Chief. Vic quickly figured out that he was confused and seemed to have some kind of dementia. She pretended Dean was the Chief and they led Earl to the lounge, where they figured out his name, but couldn't get enough information from him to contact his family. Vic called all the senior homes in the area, but none of them knew him. She then convinced Dean to play piano, hoping the music would help Earl remember. Dean started to play and Earl started to sing along, just as his daughter arrived. However, he lost his balance and became agitated, which led him to smack Vic on the cheek. His daughter, Missy, then came in and comforted him. She told Vic she just wanted a little break, a cup of coffee by herself, which is why she dropped him off. She promised not to do it again, but Vic knew she couldn't promise that and asked her just to give them a heads up next time.

==Relationships==
===Familial===
His daughter, Missy, is his primary caregiver.

==Career==
He used to be a police officer.
